maori_sentence: Ko mātau, ko nga Maori o Aotearoa, kua mau nei o mātau ingoa i raro nei ...
english_sentence: We, the aborigines of New Zealand, whose names are subscribed below ...

maori_sentence: E rua nga kura Mihinare Maori kai Ākarana.
english_sentence: There are two Maori Anglican schools in Auckland.

maori_sentence: I ēnei rā he ngāwari kē atu te tau ki te Tiri o te Moana ki te Tonga.
english_sentence: These days it is easier to reach the Antarctic.
maori_display: Tiri o te Moana ki te Tonga
maori_search: Tiri o te Moana ki te Tonga

maori_sentence: Ko te tikanga he mātao te Tiri o te Moana ki te Raki.
english_sentence: The Arctic is usually cold.
maori_display: Tiri o te Moana ki te Raki
maori_search: Tiri o te Moana ki te Raki

maori_sentence: E takoto ana te Moana Ranatiki ki waenganui o Amerika me Āwherika.
english_sentence: The Atlantic Ocean lies between America and Africa.

maori_display: (Eng) Ākuhata, Here turi kōkā, Kaiwaka, Kauawhi, Māngere
maori_search: Ākuhata, Here turi kōkā, Kaiwaka, Kauawhi, Māngere

maori_sentence: I whakahaeretia e nga Mangu Kaha he hui i te wā o te Aranga.
english_sentence: The Black Power held a hui over Easter.

maori_sentence: Te ika roa e whakatoro ana i te rangi.
english_sentence: The galaxy that stretches across the sky.
maori_display: ika roa, ika a Māui, ika o te rangi
maori_search: ika roa, ika a Māui, ika o te rangi

maori_display: (Eng) Hune, Mātahi, Pipiri, Te tahi o Pipiri, Te toru here o Pipiri
maori_search: Hune, Mātahi, Pipiri, Te tahi o Pipiri, Te toru here o Pipiri

maori_sentence: Ka taea e koe te whakapuakanga i mua i te Mana Whakaāio.
english_sentence: You can make a declaration before a Justice of the Peace.

maori_display: Haki Haratua, Haratua, Kānui rua manu, (Eng) Mei, Tuma
maori_search: Haki haratua, Haratua, Kānui rua manu, Mei, Tuma

maori_sentence: Ko ia to mātau Mema Pāremata mo nga tau maha.
english_sentence: He has been our Member of Parliament for many years.

maori_sentence: Kai te kimi mātau i tētahi Mīhaea hai ārahi i a mātau ki waho i to mātau raupatutanga.
english_sentence: We are seeking a Messiah who will lead us out of our oppression.

maori_sentence: Ka tārewa i runga Te Ika ā Māui.
english_sentence: The Milky Way hangs above.
maori_display: Te Ika ā Māui, Te Ika o te Rangi, Te Ika Roa
maori_search: Te Ika ā Māui, Te Ika o te Rangi, Te Ika Roa

maori_sentence: He mema tana taina no te Māpu Mangarū.
english_sentence: His younger brother was a member of the Mongrel Mob.

maori_sentence: E tūmanakotia ana nga Mōmona kia mahi hai kaiwhakapaoho mo to rātau hāhi.
english_sentence: Mormons are expected to work as missionaries for their church.

maori_sentence: Noho ai tātau i Te Ika ā Māui.
english_sentence: We live in the North Island.

maori_sentence: Ki te kore koe e whiwhi i te manawa reka mai i nga ture kātipa, me haere koe ki te Māngai Whai Mana.
english_sentence: You should go to the Ombudsman if you can't get satisfaction from the bureaucracy.

maori_display: Tautoru, Te Tira ō Puanga, Te Tuke ō Māui
maori_search: Tautoru, Te Tira ō Puanga, Te Tuke ō Māui

maori_sentence: Kua whakawhiti atu koe i Te Moana nui ā Kiwa.
english_sentence: You have crossed the Pacific Ocean.

maori_sentence: Tērā te Matariki te huihui i runga rā.
english_sentence: Behold, the Pleiades are clustered up above.

maori_sentence: Kai roto i nga Moutere o Te Moana nui ā Kiwa nga Moutere o Hawaii.
english_sentence: The Hawaiian Islands are in Polynesia.
maori_display: Moutere o Te Moana nui ā Kiwa
maori_search: Moutere o Te Moana nui ā Kiwa

maori_sentence: Na nga Tāngata Maori i whakakāinga nga moutere maha o te Moana nui ā Kiwa.
english_sentence: The Polynesians colonised the many islands of the Pacific Ocean.

maori_sentence: Kia whakamōhiotia atu e au koe ki a Pita Tiakihana te Kaikarakia.
english_sentence: Let me introduce you to the Reverend Pita Jackson.

maori_search: Hepetema, Mahuru, Te whā o Mahuru

maori_sentence: Ināianei kua huaina Te Kōti Matua ko Te Kōti Teitei.
english_sentence: The Supreme Court is now called the High Court.
